Detailed Description

This class manipulates the nodes of a model to track a target.

The target may be another entity / model, an entity's auxilliary data, a specific direction, or a point moving through a range of angles (for scanning).

bool Tracker::effect (  ) 

This method causes the tracker to effect its changes on a model's nodes.

Returns:
True if local transforms were changed and the model needs re-traversing

Tracker * Tracker::makeCopy ( PyModel *  pModel,
const char *  attrName 
) [virtual]

This method tells us that the given model wants to own us.

Currently we do not casually make a copy of ourselves if another model has already claimed us, rather we return an error.

void Tracker::tick ( float  dTime,
float  lod 
) [virtual]

Calculates the amount of rotation required by the model for the given frame.

This is stored as deltas to the pitch and yaw values.

Parameters:
dTime Elapsed time in seconds, since the last frame.
lod LoD at which model is to be drawn (so calculation can be abbreviated if the nodes will not be drawn)

Reimplemented from PyFashion.
